SALESFORCE HELP

MARKETING CLOUD GROWTH
Types of Content in Marketing Cloud Growth

Create and manage all your marketing content from your CMS workspace. You can create emails, landing pages, forms, images, and SMS messages for use in Marketing Cloud Growth campaigns.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Available in: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited Editions with Marketing Cloud Growth Edition
TYPE	DESCRIPTION	GOOD FOR...	AVAILABLE IN...
Email	

Create promotional or transactional emails by adding and editing familiar components.

	

Promoting products, services, or events, or for sharing updates about a transaction.

	

These campaign types:

Single email
Message series
Blank campaign

SMS Message	

Available with the Salesforce Message Credits - SMS add-on.

Create text-only marketing content that can be sent from short or long SMS codes.

	

Sharing updates about an ongoing transaction or for sending short promotional messages.

	

These campaign flow types:

Segment triggered

You must add the Send SMS Message element manually.


Landing Page	

Create promotional pages for campaign content or calls to action.

	

Sharing introductory information and hosting forms to gather prospect details for lead generation efforts.

	

These campaign types:

Signup from

Form	

Create forms that collect user information.

	

Capturing user information to generate leads.

	

These campaign types:

Signup from

Image	

Upload a media file or link to a trusted external URL. You can add a BMP, GIF, PNG, JPG, or JPEG file up to 25 MB.

See Manage Trusted URLs.

	

Enhancing emails, landing pages, or forms with logos, product photos, graphics, or other visuals.

	

These campaign and content types:

Single email
Message series
Signup form
Blank email

Images aren’t supported in SMS messages.


Brand	

Specify your company’s unique colors, text styles, and more to apply a consistent look and feel across all your marketing content.

	

Ensuring that all your marketing content is on brand. You can also create separate brands for specific events and products.

Available in emails and landing pages.

	

These content types:

Email
Landing pages
Managing Content and Sharing in Marketing Workspaces

Use the default Content Workspace for Marketing Cloud to store your marketing content. To further organize your content, create another workspace. All your workspaces appear as a list on the Content tab.

To create a marketing workspace, click Add workspace from the All CMS Workspaces list, and then select Marketing for the purpose. To start using the workspace, a content admin must add contributors and assign contributor roles.

You can share and unshare content created in one workspace (source) across multiple target marketing workspaces when you have a content admin or content manager role in both the source and target workspaces.

To establish a shared relationship for workspaces, from the workspace settings menu, click , and then select Workspace Sharing. Move the target workspaces from the Unshared column to the Shared column, and save your changes.

When you share workspaces, all items in the source workspace, including drafts, are accessible to the shared target workspaces.

To see shared content, visit the target workspace and open the “Shared with Workspaces” folder.

To modify and delete shared content, you must be a content admin, content manager, or content author in the source workspace.

To publish and unpublish shared content, you must be a content admin or content manager in the source workspace.

All marketing workspaces are connected to two default CMS channels. The Marketing Messages channel sends emails and SMS messages, and the Marketing Landing Pages site channel hosts your landing pages. When you share a source workspace, its published content becomes available to all channels in the target workspace- which includes default channels and any other site channels added to the workspace. Similarly, when you unshare a source workspace with a target workspace, its content items become unavailable in the target workspace and unpublish from the target workspace. The content is then unavailable to channels in the target workspace, and to other content items in the target workspace that reference it.

EXAMPLE  When you share Space A to Space B, you can use an image in Space A in a landing page in Space B. If space B is shared to Space C, publishing the landing page to Space C's channels will not publish the image. Instead, you need to share Space A to Space C, and then publish the image.

To see a list of workspaces that use a particular content item, open the Usage Info tab of the content detail page.
